column1: Ducky's relationship with her brother Spike becomes rambunctious and turbulent when he repeatedly keeps her awake at night with his snoring and after he ate her tree stars (which their mother packed specifically for her on their first day of school). She tells Cera about her feelings
column2: and confides that she does not know how to express them; Cera agrees to teach her. Meanwhile
column3: the children are attending a school in which they are taught by an old Pachyrhinosaurus named Mr. Thicknose
column4: who professes to have been everywhere and seen everything. Littlefoot eagerly questions the topics they cover
column5: to the old dinosaur's irritation. Eventually
column6: Mr. Thicknose complains to Grandpa Longneck about Littlefoot's behavior. Grandpa
column8: explains to him why he must be more respectful to Mr. Thicknose. Meanwhile
column11: a young dinosaur from a migrating Spiketail herd that has recently arrived in the Great Valley. Ducky begins to miss Spike when he spends more and more time with the Spiketail herd. One day
column12: the entire Valley is surprised by an overnight snowfall. While the children together have fun frolicking in the snow
column13: the adults complain that Mr. Thicknose
column14: purportedly the wisest in all of the Valley
column15: did not warn them about this impending weather
column16: and suspect that he does not know as much as he claims. As time goes on
column17: the dinosaurs begin to suffer from the freezing temperatures (through the Big Freeze) and the lack of food growth. The Spiketail herd leaves
column18: as they consume more food than most species. Tippy's mother asks Ducky and Spike's mother
column20: if she can take Spike along during the cold time; Mama Swimmer decides that Spike should choose between staying in the Valley or leaving with the Spiketails. Spike is unsure
column21: so Ducky angrily tells him to leave
column22: which he agrees to do. Afterwards
column25: and later sneaks away to follow the herd. When her friends find out
column26: they head off into the Mysterious Beyond to find her
column27: but are interrupted by Mr. Thicknose
column28: who decides to accompany them. After several mishaps
column30: but the kids defeat it with a giant snowball. In the process
column32: who was being chased by it earlier. Soon
column33: they come across a frozen pool of water that they accidentally break. Underneath the ice is a warm spring
column34: and they notice there is lush food nearby. While they relax in the water and feed
column35: Mr. Thicknose confesses that most of his knowledge comes from secondary sources; he listened to the stories of other travelers when he was a child
column37: he shared those stories to the children in the Valley. The sharptooth from earlier attacks them again
column38: but Mr. Thicknose saves the children by pushing a log off the hill
column39: causing the sharptooth to trip onto it and roll off a cliff to its presumed death. Later
column40: the group tries to contact the Valley's residents but find that a wall of snow has blocked them from entry. Ducky
column42: suggests that Cera get angry. She does so
column43: and her enraged screaming causes the snow to fall down
column44: enabling the Valley's residents to pass through. Meanwhile
column45: the Spiketail herd is starving until Spike picks up the spring's scent. He leads the Spiketails there and reunites with Ducky. However
column46: he falls into a deep part of the spring
column47: and as he is unable to swim
column48: Mama Swimmer jumps in to save him. When she places him on dry ground again
column49: Tippy's mother says that Spike should stay with his family
column50: rather than her herd. Ducky promises to Spike that she will not get angry at him whenever he snores
